sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle at wudwaxoon.
sentences.sentence_english: They began to get ready.

lines.line_english: They began to get ready.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Taan aaní yóo duwasáakw.
sentences.sentence_english: The place is called sea lion land.

lines.line_english: The place is called sea lion land.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle chʼa yá neech áwé.
sentences.sentence_english: It’s on the mainland.

lines.line_english: It’s on the mainland.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá yeedát áa yéi yatee tle lishóowu yáx̱ yatee.
sentences.sentence_english: Now it’s steep.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé wé gaaw ḵwáhé tlél aas áa yéi utéeyin yóo akaník nuch.
sentences.sentence_english: But at that time they say there weren’t any trees there.

lines.line_tlingit: Áwé wé gaaw ḵwáhé tlél aas áa yéi utéeyin yóo akaník nuch.
lines.line_english: But at that time they say there weren’t any trees there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé taan áa gaḵéech.
sentences.sentence_english: That’s where the sea lions usually sat.

lines.line_english: That’s where the sea lions usually sat.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tlax̱ yá a shakéexʼ áwé g̱anúkch tlax̱ wé aa tlein.
sentences.sentence_english: At the very top the very large one would sit.

lines.line_english: At the very top
the very large one would sit.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Noowkaḵáawu yóo chʼa lingítch áwé yéi uwasáa wé taan tlein tle tlax̱ ligéiyi aa tlein.
sentences.sentence_english: The large sea lion was called by the Tlingits “Man on the Fort” a very large one.

lines.line_tlingit: chʼa lingítch áwé yéi uwasáa wé taan tlein tle
lines.line_english: “Man on the Fort”
a very large one.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé du een át wudxooni wé du káak táakw áwé yú.á.
sentences.sentence_english: When people were preparing to go with his maternal uncle they say it was winter.

lines.line_tlingit: Áwé du een át wudxooni wé du káak
lines.line_english: When people were preparing to go with his maternal uncle
they say it was winter.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle hú tsu xwaasdáa sʼéilʼkʼi g̱áach sʼéilʼkʼi gíwé yeiḵ oonasgút.
sentences.sentence_english: But he carried a ragged rug on his shoulder, maybe a ragged cloth.

lines.line_english: But he
carried a ragged rug on his shoulder,
maybe a ragged cloth.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Dé chʼa hóochʼ áwé a káa teix̱ át áwé.
sentences.sentence_english: Those were all he slept on.

lines.line_tlingit: Dé chʼa hóochʼ áwé a káa teix̱ át áwé.
lines.line_english: Those were all he slept on.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé tle yawdwatsáḵ. Tle du shóodáx̱ deikéex̱ dultsaag̱í áwé tle yá yaakw géegit uwashée.
sentences.sentence_english: They didn’t want him to go. When they were pushing away from him he reached for the stern of the boat.

lines.line_english: They didn’t want him to go.

lines.line_english: When they were pushing away from him
he reached for the stern of the boat.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yéi akanéek tle aax̱ akawltéix̱ʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: They say he twisted it off.

lines.line_english: They say he twisted it off.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle dáag̱i ḵoon aawayeesh. Aag̱áa áwé tsaa a yíx̱ woogoot.
sentences.sentence_english: Then he pulled it up on the beach with the men in it. That’s when he stepped in.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle dáag̱i ḵoon aawayeesh. Aag̱áa áwé tsaa a yíx̱ woogoot.
lines.line_english: Then he pulled it up on the beach with the men in it. That’s when he stepped in.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Á áwé chʼu yeedát a yáx̱ at g̱at.lkóo nuch, “chʼa wé sheen x̱ʼayee áwé áx̱ woogoot.” Áwé yaa yakwnaḵúx̱u áwé kaskooxúx̱ sitee hú ḵwá.
sentences.sentence_english: Even till now there is a proverb from this, “He just went as a bailer.” Then, when they were paddling along, he was a bailer.

lines.line_tlingit: Á áwé chʼu yeedát a yáx̱ at g̱at.lkóo nuch, “chʼa wé sheen x̱ʼayee áwé áx̱ woogoot.”
lines.line_english: Even till now there is a proverb from this, “He just went as a bailer.”

he was a bailer.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼa kunaaléi aadé yaa yakwnaḵúx̱ yé.
sentences.sentence_english: It was kind of far where they were paddling to.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼa kunaaléi aadé yaa yakwnaḵúx̱ yé.
lines.line_english: It was kind of far where they were paddling to.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: At yakwḵóox̱ áwé tle tle héèni woogoot wé du káak.
sentences.sentence_english: When they got there his maternal uncle stepped off the boat.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Wáa latseení sáyá taan yátxʼi yóo ayagwáldi tle tle a een chʼa du jín tin.
sentences.sentence_english: He was so strong when he punched the cub sea lions he killed them with his bare hands.

lines.line_english: He was so strong when he punched the cub sea lions

lines.line_english: he killed them with his bare hands.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Daaḵ nagút chʼa xʼoon sáwé aawajáḵ tle wé taan.
sentences.sentence_english: How many sea lions he killed as he was going up!

lines.line_english: How many sea lions he killed
as he was going up!

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé tlax̱ wé a shakéet aa aa áwé du tóoch wulichéesh áa kei uwagút.
sentences.sentence_english: But he wanted to get at the one sitting at the top of the island.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá a geen áwé akaawa.aaḵw. Wóoshdáx̱ a tlʼeiḵ akg̱wasʼéilʼ tle wé taan.
sentences.sentence_english: He tried the flippers. He tried to rip it apart by the flippers.

lines.line_english: He tried the flippers. He tried to rip it apart by the flippers.

sentences.sentence_english: But as he was sitting down on its neck the sea lion raised its flipper and tossed him up in the air.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yindasháàn áwé tsá wé tayaḵáash káa yan shaawagásʼ. Tle hóochʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: He fell head first on a rock. Then he was gone.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle shakaawawálʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: His head was fractured.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Eeshandéìn ḵaa tuwatee wé hasdu sháade háni aadé wooteeyi yé.
sentences.sentence_english: People felt grief about what happened to their leader.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ách áwé wé ḵáa ḵu.aa Atkaháasʼi yóo wdwasáa wé l ushnéekʼich áwé tle wudiháàn.
sentences.sentence_english: But that’s why that man, he was named Atkaháasʼi because he didn't keep himself clean, stood up.

because he didn't keep himself clean,

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé tle yéi x̱ʼadutee, “Aadóoch sá daak uwax̱útʼ yá Aanloowú?
sentences.sentence_english: They imitate him saying, “Who do you think pulled out the Village Nose?

lines.line_english: They imitate him saying,
“Who do you think pulled out the Village Nose?

sentences.sentence_tlingit: X̱áach x̱áawé daak x̱waax̱útʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: It was I who pulled it out.

lines.line_english: It was I who pulled it out.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aadóoch sá aawaxʼáa yá aas yá Aanka.aasí?
sentences.sentence_english: Who do you think split this tree, the Village Tree?

the Village Tree?

sentences.sentence_tlingit: X̱áach x̱áawé.” Áwé tle yaa nagúdi áwé tle yaakw yíx̱ daaḵ nagút.
sentences.sentence_english: It was I.” Then as he went, he went up walking through the boat.

sentences.sentence_english: But when he jumped on them he didn’t even slip.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Wé taan yátxʼi át ḵín yé ḵwa wé íḵde g̱aḵéech.
sentences.sentence_english: The place where young sea lions sit is closer to the sea.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼa wáa sáwé ayagwált tle yax̱ yaa ayanaljáḵ. Tle yóo kínde woogoot wé du káak aawajág̱i taan tlein a ginkáa wjḵaaḵ. Chʼa g̱íg̱aa kínde yóo yax̱ ash siné. Tléikʼ!

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle yá a geen tle yáa yá woosh dakádin yóo awusneiyí áwé wóoshdáx̱ akaawasʼéilʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: Then he took it by the flippers and ripped it in half.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A g̱óotx̱ yaa analyéx̱. Yéi áwé kawdudlneek.
sentences.sentence_english: He kept on slaughtering them. That’s how they tell of him.

lines.line_english: He kept on slaughtering them.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áyá dleewkwát ash daat yawstaag̱i aa du káak shátch áwé du jeet uwatée wé át dáa.
sentences.sentence_english: The one that cared for him, his maternal uncle’s wife, was the one who had given him that thing, the ermine.

sentences.sentence_english: When he was going into the water toward the sea lion he tied it to his hair as what we call “chʼéen.”

sentences.sentence_tlingit: (You know that soot.) Aan áwé tsá héèni woogoot.
sentences.sentence_english: (You know that soot.) With this he finally went ashore.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ách áwé tle wé chʼa yéi nateech wé du káak wé ash daat yawstag̱i aa yéi kduník nuch yanwáadi aa du káak shát áwé tle tóot ajeewatán.
sentences.sentence_english: That was why, when his maternal uncle died it is said, the nephew asked for the hand of the one who cared for him, the one who was older.

sentences.sentence_english: It was really that way long ago.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá ḵaa káak nag̱anéìn tle wé a shát áwé aax̱ kei duteejín.
sentences.sentence_english: When a maternal uncle died the wife was claimed by the nephew.

sentences.sentence_english: But he didn’t even notice the young one.

sentences.sentence_english: People didn’t know what his name was, his name became G̱alwéitʼ, his maternal uncle’s name.

sentences.sentence_english: People in many places don't know her name.
